field.description:
This option handles the extraction of clients' usernames from various sources, such as Proxy-Authorization headers and ident servers, enabling requests to be handled according to the settings of the user's filter group.
Use CTRL + Click for multiple select.
Note: Do NOT select more then one auth plugin if you plan to use more then one listening interface.

Scan options. Default values are in ( ).
Use CTRL + click for multiple select.

option.name: Reverse Lookups for Banned Sites and URLs (off)

field.description: IMPORTANT: Note that setting this to "0" turns off all features which extract phrases from page content,  including banned and exception phrases (not just weighted), search term filtering, and scanning for links to banned URLs.

option.name: Singular = each weighted phrase found only counts once on a page. (default)
Off = do not use the weighted phrase feature.

field.description:
When a document is scanned the uppercase letters are converted to lower case in order to compare them with the phrases.
However this can break Big5 and other 16-bit texts. If needed, preserve the case.

option.name: Scan first in lower case, then in original case

field.description:
This settings affects phrase content filtering options.
Smart - multiple spaces and HTML are removed before phrase filtering.
Raw - the raw HTML including meta tags are phrase filtered.
Meta/Title - only meta and title tags are phrase filtered (very fast).
CPU usage can be effectively halved by using setting 0 or 1 compared to 2.

Caches good pages so they don't need to be scanned again. It also works with AV plugins.
0 = off (recommended for ISPs with users with disimilar browsing)
1000 = recommended for most users
5000 = suggested max. upper limit
If you are using an AV plugin, then use at least 5000.

Age (in seconds) before the cached good pages should be considered stale and ignored.
900 = 15 mins (recommended)
0 = Never

Select Certificate Authority to use when SSL filtering is enabled in Group options.
To create a CA on pfSense, go to System -> Cert Manager.

Select certificate pair to use when SSL filtering is enabled in Group options.
To create a certificate on pfSense, go to System -> Cert Manager.
Content Scanners options. Default values are in ( ).

Default: Every day
Select how often pfSense will update clamd virus database

Default is 60.
Some of the content scanners support setting a timeout value to stop processing (e.g. AV scanning) the file when it takes too long.
This will only be used if supported by the content scanner.
The default of 60 seconds is probably reasonable.

If on, exception sites, URLs, users, etc. will be scanned.
This is probably not desirable behaviour, since exceptions are supposed to be trusted and will increase load.
Correct usage of grey lists is a better idea.

Enter ICAP URL in icap://icapserver:1344/avscan format
Use hostname rather than IP address. Always specify the port.
Misc options. Default values are in ( ).

option.name: Use X-Forwarded-For Header to Determine the Client IP (off)
